meta.title: store/cart/deleted - Models - Webhooks - Management APIs - API Reference
meta.description: This webhook fires whenever a cart is deleted. Cart deletion occurs either when all items have been removed from a cart which causes auto-deletion, or w...

blocks.data:
This webhook fires whenever a cart is deleted. Cart deletion occurs either when all items have been removed from a cart which causes auto-deletion, or when an API consumer explicitly removes the cart through a `DELETE` request. Cart deletion ends the lifecycle of the cart. The `store/cart/updated` webhook also fires when the last item is removed.

### Example callback:

```json
{
  "created_at": 1561482670,
  "store_id": "1025646",
  "producer": "stores/{store_hash}",
  "scope": "store/cart/deleted",
  "hash": "352e4afc6dd3fc85ea26bfdf3f91852604d57528",
  "data": {
    "type": "cart",
    "id": "09346904-4175-44fd-be53-f7e598531b6c"
  }
}
```

### Callback schema:

created_at.description: Hook creation date as a Unix timestamp.

store_id.description: A numerical identifier that is unique to each store.

producer.description: Will always follow the pattern `stores/store_hash`. This is the store that created the webhook.

scope.description: The event registered when the webhook was created.

hash.description: The payload data JSON encoded then passed through SH1 encryption.

allOf.description: A lightweight description of the event that triggered the webhook. Will vary depending on the event registered.

data.description: A lightweight description of the event that triggered the webhook.
